---

I've implemented the UI from the screenshot in `Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor` and created a companion CSS file for the styling.

I used `RadzenButton` for the menu items and `RadzenDropDown` for the language selector. The visual style (gradients, icon placement, centered text) is handled via scoped CSS to match the "WinForms/Industrial" look of the original interface.

### 1. CSS Styling
I created `Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor.css` to define the button gradients and layout.

```css:Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor.css
.engineering-container {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-columns: 350px 1fr;
    gap: 40px;
    padding: 40px;
    height: 100%;
    align-content: flex-start;
}

.button-stack {
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    gap: 15px;
}

.eng-btn {
    width: 100%;
    height: 50px;
    /* Silver gradient similar to WinForms/Industrial look */
    background: linear-gradient(to bottom, #f5f5f5 0%, #e0e0e0 40%, #cccccc 100%) !important;
    border: 1px solid #999 !important;
    color: #333 !important;
    font-weight: bold !important;
    border-radius: 5px !important;
    box-shadow: 0 2px 3px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
    text-transform: none !important;
    padding: 0 15px !important;
    display: flex !important;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: flex-start !important;
    font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
}

.eng-btn:hover {
    background: linear-gradient(to bottom, #ffffff 0%, #f0f0f0 100%) !important;
}

.eng-btn:active {
    background: #cccccc !important;
    box-shadow: inset 0 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
}

/* Orange button style for 'Disable Test Log' */
.active-orange {
    background: linear-gradient(to bottom, #fff5e6 0%, #ffcc80 40%, #ffb74d 100%) !important;
    border: 1px solid #f57c00 !important;
}

.active-orange:hover {
    background: linear-gradient(to bottom, #fffaf0 0%, #ffdca0 100%) !important;
}

/* Radzen inner elements styling */
::deep .rz-button-icon-left {
    font-size: 24px !important;
    margin-right: 15px !important;
    color: #444;
    opacity: 0.8;
}

::deep .rz-button-text {
    flex: 1;
    text-align: center;
    font-size: 14px;
}

.language-selector {
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
    gap: 15px;
    margin-top: 100px; /* Align vertically similar to screenshot */
    justify-content: center;
    height: 40px;
}

.language-label {
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 14px;
    color: #333;
}
```

### 2. Component Markup
I updated `Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor` to include the buttons with appropriate icons.

```razor:Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor
@using Radzen
@using Radzen.Blazor

<div class="engineering-container">
    <div class="button-stack">
        <!-- Hand Program: Hammer icon -->
        <RadzenButton Text="Hand Program" Icon="build" Class="eng-btn" />
        
        <!-- IO Editor: Chip/Board icon -->
        <RadzenButton Text="IO Editor" Icon="memory" Class="eng-btn" />
        
        <!-- AI & RTD Correction: Gauge icon -->
        <RadzenButton Text="AI & RTD Correction" Icon="speed" Class="eng-btn" />
        
        <!-- Disable Test Log: Checkmark icon, Orange styling -->
        <RadzenButton Text="Disable Test Log" Icon="check" Class="eng-btn active-orange" />
        
        <!-- Test Log Viewer: Pen/Paper icon -->
        <RadzenButton Text="Test Log Viewer" Icon="edit_note" Class="eng-btn" />
        
        <!-- Test Sequence Editor: List/Code icon -->
        <RadzenButton Text="Test Sequence Editor" Icon="playlist_add_check" Class="eng-btn" />
        
        <!-- View Gas & DHW Charts: Chart icon -->
        <RadzenButton Text="View Gas & DHW Charts" Icon="show_chart" Class="eng-btn" />
    </div>

    <div class="language-selector">
        <span class="language-label">Language</span>
        <RadzenDropDown Data="@languages" @bind-Value="selectedLanguage" Style="width: 250px;" />
    </div>
</div>

@code {
    string selectedLanguage = "French (fr)";
    List<string> languages = new List<string> 
    { 
        "English (en)", 
        "French (fr)", 
        "German (de)",
        "Spanish (es)",
        "Italian (it)",
        "Russian (ru)"
    };
}
```

_**User (2025-12-03 17:42Z)**_

_**Agent (model gemini-3-pro-preview, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Assessing the Layout**

I'm focusing on the layout of buttons in `Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor`. I'm verifying the current column arrangement, and thinking about how to make them visually more appealing. I'm considering potential CSS adjustments and how to ensure consistent display across different screen sizes.


**Troubleshooting the CSS**

The buttons are still horizontal, and the CSS `flex-direction: column` isn't applying as expected. I'm investigating the CSS isolation and potential class overrides. There might be an issue with how the `.button-stack` class is being applied or if the grid container is impacting button layout.


**Pinpointing the Root Cause**

I've discovered the issue! My scoped CSS wasn't being applied because the necessary link tag was missing from `index.html`. It needs to point to the bundled CSS file. This explains why the buttons were using default Radzen styles and not adopting the column layout and custom styling. Now, I will re-examine the CSS to ensure the desired look is achieved and the buttons are stacked.


**Addressing the CSS Link**

I've just confirmed the CSS isn't applied due to a missing `<link>` tag in `index.html`. It should have pointed to the bundled CSS. I'll add that immediately. After that, I will review the CSS for the button column layout, and also the "industrial" styling.


**Verifying and Refining Style**

Okay, I've reviewed the `index.html` file, and confirmed the absence of the crucial CSS link. I'll insert `<link href="Final_Test_Hybrid.styles.css" rel="stylesheet" />` to fix the CSS application. After that, I plan to revisit the button styling, and specifically, the gradients and 3D bevel effects to match the reference image. The icon colors will be checked too.


**Verifying CSS Application**

I'm now fully immersed in the core issue: the missing CSS link in `index.html`. I've re-examined the file and the link is definitely absent, which explains the unstyled buttons. The next steps will be to add the correct CSS link and then finely tune the styling in `MainEngineering.razor.css` to precisely match the target design, with attention paid to the "industrial" aesthetic. I'll focus on the gradients, 3D effects, and the orange/yellow button, too.


</details></think>

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Diagnosing CSS Issues**

I've pinpointed the issue: `Final_Test_Hybrid.styles.css` is absent. This file, auto-generated by Blazor, is crucial for CSS isolation. Because it's missing, styles from `MainEngineering.razor.css` are ignored, leading to the Radzen defaults like the blue buttons.


**Adding the Stylesheet Link**

I've added the crucial `<link>` tag to `index.html` referencing `Final_Test_Hybrid.styles.css`. Next, I plan to meticulously adjust the `MainEngineering.razor.css` file to match the desired industrial aesthetic. I'll focus on getting the button appearance right, including the correct colors and icon placement. I must also consider the "Disable Test Log" button, ensuring the appropriate visual feedback for its active and inactive states.


**Confirming the Missing CSS**

I've reconfirmed the absence of `Final_Test_Hybrid.styles.css`. I'm preparing to insert the `<link>` tag in `index.html` to link the auto-generated styles. My next step will be to thoroughly review and adjust the `MainEngineering.razor.css` file to ensure the industrial aesthetic aligns perfectly, especially the button styles. I'm focusing on the colors, icon placement, and the distinct visual states for the "Disable Test Log" button.


</details></think>

I have updated the application to correctly apply the scoped styles and refined the UI to match the screenshot's industrial look.

### Key Changes
1.  **Fixed CSS Isolation**: Added `<link href="Final_Test_Hybrid.styles.css" rel="stylesheet" />` to `wwwroot/index.html`. This was missing, which prevented the scoped CSS from loading (explaining why the previous buttons were blue and horizontal).
2.  **Refined CSS Styles (`MainEngineering.razor.css`)**:
    -   **Layout**: Enforced a vertical column layout (`flex-direction: column`).
    -   **Gradients**: Applied a "hard" gradient (silver/metallic style) with a sharp transition at 50% to mimic the Windows Forms/Industrial 3D button look.
    -   **Icon Colors**: Added specific classes to color the icons (Hammer -> Red, Chip -> Green, Checkmark -> Bright Green) to match the visual cues in the original screenshot.
    -   **Orange Button**: Refined the "Disable Test Log" button to use a gold/orange gradient.
3.  **Updated Markup (`MainEngineering.razor`)**: Added the helper classes (`btn-icon-red`, etc.) and ensured the correct structure.

The buttons will now appear in a vertical stack with the specific "industrial" styling requested.

I have refactored the component to include the styles directly in the `.razor` file and deleted the `.css` file as requested.

### Changes Made
1.  **Embedded Styles**: Moved all CSS into a `<style>` block within `Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor`.
2.  **Deleted File**: Removed `Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor.css`.
3.  **Refined Selectors**: Updated the CSS selectors to be more specific (`.rz-button.eng-btn`) and used `!important` on `background-image` and `background-color` to ensure the silver/industrial gradient overrides the default Radzen blue theme.
4.  **Icon Colors**: Ensured the specific icon color overrides (`.btn-icon-red`, etc.) target the inner `.rz-button-icon-left` correctly without relying on `::deep` (since it's now in the global scope of the component's style block).

This should force the buttons to adopt the intended "Industrial Silver" look instead of the default blue.

I have updated `Components/Engineer/MainEngineering.razor` to make the buttons darker and increase contrast.

### Changes
-   **Darker Gradients**: The main button gradient now uses `#e6e6e6` (top), `#cccccc` (mid-top), `#999999` (mid-bottom), and `#cccccc` (bottom) instead of the lighter versions. This provides a stronger 3D "metallic" effect.
-   **Darker Borders**: Changed border color from `#888` to `#666` for better definition against the grey background.
-   **Adjusted Shadows**: Increased shadow opacity slightly to make the buttons "pop" more.
-   **Hover State**: Adjusted the hover gradient to be slightly lighter than the new default but still darker than the previous version to maintain consistency.
